Key Match Events: Markkanen didn't come back out for the second half due to back soreness and the Kings broke open the game. Behind Fox's 10 points, they outscored the Jazz 29-14 in the third quarter, including a 14-2 run to end the period.
The Jazz have lost their last two home games by a combined 58 points.
Pre-Game Insights: The Jazz struggled with Sacramento's dribble penetration and crisp passing while often having three or four rookies and second-year players on the floor.
Miscellaneous Highlights: DeRozan had his fourth straight game with at least 20 points to begin his time with the Kings. Only Chris Webber (seven games, Feb. 5-17, 1999) and Oscar Robertson (six games, Oct. 19-27, 1960) have had longer streaks to start their tenures with the franchise.
The Kings shot just 25.8% from 3-point range but hit 65.6% inside the arc.
Others: The Kings visit Atlanta on Friday and the Jazz host San Antonio on Thursday.
